member.name: P:Xenko.Physics.ColliderShape.Scaling
member.summary: Gets or sets the scaling. Make sure that you manually created and assigned an exclusive ColliderShape to the Collider otherwise since the engine shares shapes among many Colliders, all the colliders will be scaled. Please note that this scaling has no relation to the TransformComponent scaling.

member.summary: 3D only

member.userdoc: Select this if this shape will represent a 2D shape

member.userdoc: The length of the capsule (distance between the center of the two sphere centers).

member.userdoc: The radius of the capsule.

member.name: F:Xenko.Physics.CapsuleColliderShapeDesc.Orientation
member.userdoc: The orientation of the capsule.

member.userdoc: The offset with the real graphic mesh.

member.name: F:Xenko.Physics.CapsuleColliderShapeDesc.LocalRotation
member.userdoc: The local rotation of the collider shape.

member.name: P:Xenko.Physics.ColliderShapeAssetDesc.Shape
member.userdoc: The reference to the collider Shape asset.

member.name: F:Xenko.Physics.ConeColliderShapeDesc.Height
member.userdoc: The height of the cylinder

member.name: F:Xenko.Physics.ConeColliderShapeDesc.Radius
member.userdoc: The radius of the cylinder

member.name: F:Xenko.Physics.ConeColliderShapeDesc.Orientation
member.userdoc: The orientation of the cylinder.

member.name: F:Xenko.Physics.ConeColliderShapeDesc.LocalOffset
member.userdoc: The offset with the real graphic mesh.

member.name: F:Xenko.Physics.ConeColliderShapeDesc.LocalRotation
member.userdoc: The local rotation of the collider shape.

member.name: F:Xenko.Physics.ConvexHullColliderShapeDesc.Model
member.userdoc: Model asset from where the engine will derive the convex hull.

member.name: F:Xenko.Physics.ConvexHullColliderShapeDesc.LocalOffset
member.userdoc: The offset with the real graphic mesh.

member.name: F:Xenko.Physics.ConvexHullColliderShapeDesc.LocalRotation
member.userdoc: The local rotation of the collider shape.

member.name: F:Xenko.Physics.ConvexHullColliderShapeDesc.SimpleWrap
member.userdoc: If this is checked the following parameters are totally ignored, as only a simple convex hull of the whole model will be generated.

member.name: F:Xenko.Physics.ConvexHullColliderShapeDesc.Scaling
member.userdoc: The scaling of the generated convex hull.

member.name: F:Xenko.Physics.ConvexHullColliderShapeDesc.Depth
member.userdoc: Control how many sub convex hulls will be created, more depth will result in a more complex decomposition.

member.name: F:Xenko.Physics.ConvexHullColliderShapeDesc.PosSampling
member.userdoc: How many position samples to internally compute clipping planes ( the higher the more complex ).

member.name: F:Xenko.Physics.ConvexHullColliderShapeDesc.AngleSampling
member.userdoc: How many angle samples to internally compute clipping planes ( the higher the more complex ), nested with position samples, for each position sample it will compute the amount defined here.

member.name: F:Xenko.Physics.ConvexHullColliderShapeDesc.PosRefine
member.userdoc: If higher then 0 the computation will try to further improve the shape position sampling (this will slow down the process).

member.name: F:Xenko.Physics.ConvexHullColliderShapeDesc.AngleRefine
member.userdoc: If higher then 0 the computation will try to further improve the shape angle sampling (this will slow down the process).

member.name: F:Xenko.Physics.ConvexHullColliderShapeDesc.Alpha
member.userdoc: Applied to the concavity during crippling plane approximation.

member.name: F:Xenko.Physics.ConvexHullColliderShapeDesc.Threshold
member.userdoc: Threshold of concavity, rising this will make the shape simpler.

member.name: F:Xenko.Physics.CylinderColliderShapeDesc.Height
member.userdoc: The height of the cylinder

member.name: F:Xenko.Physics.CylinderColliderShapeDesc.Radius
member.userdoc: The radius of the cylinder

member.name: F:Xenko.Physics.CylinderColliderShapeDesc.Orientation
member.userdoc: The orientation of the cylinder.

member.name: F:Xenko.Physics.CylinderColliderShapeDesc.LocalOffset
member.userdoc: The offset with the real graphic mesh.

member.name: F:Xenko.Physics.CylinderColliderShapeDesc.LocalRotation
member.userdoc: The local rotation of the collider shape.

member.name: F:Xenko.Physics.SphereColliderShapeDesc.Is2D
member.userdoc: Select this if this shape will represent a Circle 2D shape

member.name: F:Xenko.Physics.SphereColliderShapeDesc.Radius
member.userdoc: The radius of the sphere/circle.

member.name: F:Xenko.Physics.SphereColliderShapeDesc.LocalOffset
member.userdoc: The offset with the real graphic mesh.

member.userdoc: The normal of the infinite plane.

member.userdoc: The distance offset.

member.summary: Jumps this instance.

member.name: M:Xenko.Physics.CharacterComponent.Jump
member.summary: Jumps this instance.

member.name: P:Xenko.Physics.CharacterComponent.StepHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the height of the character step.
member.value: The height of the character step.
member.userdoc: Only valid for CharacterController type, describes the max slope height a character can climb. Cannot change during run-time.

member.name: P:Xenko.Physics.CharacterComponent.FallSpeed
member.summary: Gets or sets if this character element fall speed
member.userdoc: The fall speed of this character

member.name: P:Xenko.Physics.CharacterComponent.MaxSlope
member.summary: Gets or sets if this character element max slope
member.userdoc: The max slope this character can climb

member.name: P:Xenko.Physics.CharacterComponent.JumpSpeed
member.summary: Gets or sets if this character jump speed
member.userdoc: The speed of the jump

member.name: P:Xenko.Physics.CharacterComponent.Gravity
member.summary: Gets or sets if this character gravity
member.userdoc: The gravity force applied to this character

member.name: P:Xenko.Physics.CharacterComponent.IsGrounded
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this instance is on the ground.
member.value: true if this instance is grounded; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Xenko.Physics.CharacterComponent.Teleport(Xenko.Core.Mathematics.Vector3)
member.summary: Teleports the specified target position.

member.name: M:Xenko.Physics.CharacterComponent.Move(Xenko.Core.Mathematics.Vector3)
member.summary: Moves the character towards the specified movement vector. Motion will stay in place unless modified or canceled passing Vector3.Zero.
member.param: The velocity vector, typically direction * delta time `var dt = this.GetSimulation().FixedTimeStep;` * speed.

member.name: M:Xenko.Physics.CharacterComponent.SetVelocity(Xenko.Core.Mathematics.Vector3)
member.summary: Sets the character velocity. Velocity will be applied every frame unless modified or canceled passing Vector3.Zero.
member.remarks: The engine internally will multiply velocity with the simulation fixed time step.
member.param: The velocity vector, typically direction * speed.

member.remarks: This orientation has no impact in the physics simulation

member.name: P:Xenko.Physics.RigidbodyComponent.Mass
member.summary: Gets or sets the mass of this Rigidbody
member.userdoc: Objects with higher mass push objects with lower mass more when they collide. For large differences, use point values; for example, write 0.1 or 10, not 1 or 100000.

member.name: F:Xenko.Physics.RigidBodyTypes.Static
member.summary: They are supposed to never move, they are not automatically updated by the engine. They can be moved tho by an explicit call to UpdateTransformation(), results are not realist for dynamic simulation so use it wisely. If you plan to move the entity it is advised to use Kinematic, which allows the normal dynamic simulation.

member.name: F:Xenko.Physics.RigidBodyTypes.Dynamic
member.summary: The Physics engine is the authority for this kind of rigidbody, you should move them using forces and/or impulses, never directly editing the Transformation

member.name: F:Xenko.Physics.RigidBodyTypes.Kinematic
member.summary: You can move this kind of rigidbody around and the physics engine will interpolate and perform dynamic interactions with dynamic bodies Notice that there is no dynamic interaction with static and other kinematic bodies

member.name: M:Xenko.Physics.StaticPlaneColliderShape.#ctor(Xenko.Core.Mathematics.Vector3,System.Single)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. A static plane that is solid to infinity on one side. Several of these can be used to confine a convex space in a manner that completely prevents tunneling to the outside. The plane itself is specified with a normal and distance as is standard in mathematics.

member.name: P:Xenko.Physics.Simulation.Gravity
member.summary: Gets or sets the gravity.
member.exception: Cannot perform this action when the physics engine is set to CollisionsOnly or Cannot perform this action when the physics engine is set to CollisionsOnly

member.name: P:Xenko.Physics.Simulation.MaxSubSteps
member.summary: The maximum number of steps that the Simulation is allowed to take each tick. If the engine is running slow (large deltaTime), then you must increase the number of maxSubSteps to compensate for this, otherwise your simulation is losing time. It's important that frame DeltaTime is always less than MaxSubSteps*FixedTimeStep, otherwise you are losing time.

member.name: P:Xenko.Physics.Simulation.FixedTimeStep
member.summary: By decreasing the size of fixedTimeStep, you are increasing the resolution of the simulation. Default is 1.0f / 60.0f or 60fps

member.name: E:Xenko.Physics.Simulation.SimulationBegin
member.summary: Called right before the physics simulation. This event might not be fired by the main thread.

member.name: E:Xenko.Physics.Simulation.SimulationEnd
member.summary: Called right after the physics simulation. This event might not be fired by the main thread.

member.name: P:Xenko.Engine.PhysicsComponent.ColliderShapes
member.userdoc: The reference to the collider shape of this element.

member.name: P:Xenko.Engine.PhysicsComponent.CollisionGroup
member.summary: Gets or sets the collision group.
member.userdoc: Which collision group the component belongs to. This can't be changed at runtime. The default is DefaultFilter.
member.remarks: The collider will still produce events, to allow non trigger rigidbodies or static colliders to act as a trigger if required for certain filtering groups.

members.member:
Gets or sets the can collide with.
The can collide with.
Which collider groups this component collides with. With nothing selected, it collides with all groups. This can't be changed at runtime.
/// The collider will still produce events, to allow non trigger rigidbodies or static colliders to act as a trigger if required for certain filtering groups.

member.name: P:Xenko.Engine.PhysicsComponent.ProcessCollisions
member.summary: Gets or sets if this element will store collisions
member.userdoc: You can use collision events in scripts. If you have no scripts using collision events for this component, disable this option to save CPU. It has no effect on physics.

member.name: P:Xenko.Engine.PhysicsComponent.Enabled
member.summary: Gets or sets if this element is enabled in the physics engine
member.userdoc: If this element is enabled in the physics engine

member.name: P:Xenko.Engine.PhysicsComponent.CanSleep
member.summary: Gets or sets if this element can enter sleep state
member.userdoc: Don't process this physics component when it's not moving. This saves CPU.

member.name: P:Xenko.Engine.PhysicsComponent.IsActive
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this instance is active (awake).
member.value: true if this instance is active; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Xenko.Engine.PhysicsComponent.Activate(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Attempts to awake the collider.

member.name: P:Xenko.Engine.PhysicsComponent.Restitution
member.summary: Gets or sets if this element restitution
member.userdoc: The amount of kinetic energy lost or gained after a collision. If the restitution of colliding entities is 0, the entities lose all energy and stop moving immediately on impact. If the restitution is 1, they lose no energy and rebound with the same velocity they collided at. Use this to change the component "bounciness". A typical value is between 0 and 1.

member.name: P:Xenko.Engine.PhysicsComponent.Friction
member.summary: Gets or sets the friction of this element
member.userdoc: The friction
member.remarks: It's importantant to realise that friction and restitution are not values of any particular surface, but rather a value of the interaction of two surfaces. So why is it defined for each object? In order to determine the overall friction and restitution between any two surfaces in a collision.

member.name: P:Xenko.Engine.PhysicsComponent.RollingFriction
member.summary: Gets or sets the rolling friction of this element
member.userdoc: The rolling friction

member.name: P:Xenko.Engine.PhysicsComponent.Tag
member.summary: Gets or sets the tag.

member.summary: Computes the physics transformation from the TransformComponent values

member.name: M:Xenko.Engine.PhysicsComponent.DeriveBonePhysicsTransformation(Xenko.Core.Mathematics.Matrix@)
member.summary: Computes the physics transformation from the TransformComponent values

member.name: M:Xenko.Engine.PhysicsComponent.UpdateTransformationComponent(Xenko.Core.Mathematics.Matrix@)
member.summary: Updades the graphics transformation from the given physics transformation

member.name: M:Xenko.Engine.PhysicsComponent.UpdateBoneTransformation(Xenko.Core.Mathematics.Matrix@)
member.summary: Updades the graphics transformation from the given physics transformation

member.name: M:Xenko.Engine.PhysicsComponent.UpdatePhysicsTransformation
member.summary: Forces an update from the TransformComponent to the Collider.PhysicsWorldTransform. Useful to manually force movements. In the case of dynamic rigidbodies a velocity reset should be applied first.

member.name: T:Xenko.XenkoVersion
member.summary: Internal version used to identify Xenko version.
member.remarks: Note: Xenko.xkpkg and PublicVersion versions should match. Also, during package build, PackageUpdateVersionTask is updating that file and expect some specific text regex so be careful if you change any of this.

member.name: F:Xenko.XenkoVersion.PublicVersion
member.summary: The version used by editor for display purpose. 4th digit needs to be at least 1 if used (due to NuGet special cases).

member.name: F:Xenko.XenkoVersion.AssemblyVersion
member.summary: The current assembly version as text, currently same as .

member.name: F:Xenko.XenkoVersion.NuGetVersionSimple
member.summary: The NuGet package version without special tags.

member.name: F:Xenko.XenkoVersion.NuGetVersion
member.summary: The NuGet package version.

member.name: F:Xenko.XenkoVersion.NuGetVersionSuffix
member.summary: The NuGet package suffix (i.e. -beta01). Note: might be replaced during package build.

member.name: F:Xenko.XenkoVersion.AssemblyInformationalVersion
member.summary: The informational assembly version, containing -dev or -g[git_hash] during package.

member.name: F:Xenko.XenkoVersion.AssemblyInformationalSuffix
member.summary: The assembly suffix. Note: replaced by git commit during package build.
